metadata.Title: CVE-2020-12399 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
NSS has shown timing differences when performing DSA signatures, which was exploitable and could eventually leak private keys. This vulnerability affects Thunderbird < 68.9.0, Firefox < 77, and Firefox ESR < 68.9.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-12399` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 77.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 77.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 77.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

libnss3 - 2:3.28.4-0ubuntu0.16.04.11
libnss3-1d - 2:3.28.4-0ubuntu0.16.04.11
libnss3-nssdb - 2:3.28.4-0ubuntu0.16.04.11
libnss3-tools - 2:3.28.4-0ubuntu0.16.04.11
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:68.10.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:68.10.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:68.10.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:68.10.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:68.10.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:68.10.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required
